data.title: Colorado Parks & Wildlife
data.meta_description: Colorado Parks and Wildlife is a nationally recognized leader in conservation, outdoor recreation and wildlife management. The agency​ manages 42 state parks, all of Colorado's wildlife, more than 300 state wildlife areas and a host of recreational programs. CPW issues hunting and fishing licenses, conducts research to improve wildlife management activities, protects high priority wildlife habitat through acquisitions and partnerships, provides technical assistance to private and other public landowners concerning wildlife and habitat management and develops programs to understand, protect and recover threatened and endangered species.
data.text:
Events

Beginner’s Level 1 Mountain Bike Lesson - Fundamentals @ Cheyenne Mountain State Park

Have a mountain bike but not really sure how to ride it? Bring your bikes, helmets, snacks, and water and join our BICP certified mountain bike instructor, Ranger Rick, to learn the fundamentals of mountain biking!

Build-a-Bug Hotel @ Cheyenne Mountain State Park

Join us as we venture into the world of invertebrate architecture!

Meteor Shower Watch Party @ Cheyenne Mountain State Park

Join astronomers from Colorado Springs Astronomical Society for a meteor shower watch party!

Wildflower Wednesday Hike @ Cheyenne Mountain State Park

Please join us for Wildflower Wednesday, where we will hunt for and discuss "what is blooming” on various trails in the park.

Sturgeon Moon Night Hike @ Cheyenne Mountain

Join us for a 3 mile Sturgeon Moon Night Hike, where we will navigate Cheyenne Mountain State Park trails by the light of the moon.

Public Archery Lessons @ Cheyenne Mountain State Park 9-10:30AM

This lesson covers archery safety, range safety, bow basics, proper stance, aiming, and arrow release.

Crafts in the Park @ Cheyenne Mountain

Are you a human who enjoys crafts? Join our volunteer artisan, Nancy, for a morning of crafting in the park! This month we will be creating dried flower cards - perfect for gifting or keeping!

Public Archery Lessons @ Cheyenne Mountain State Park 11-12:30PM

This lesson covers archery safety, range safety, bow basics, proper stance, aiming, and arrow release.

Brilliant Birds Hike @ Cheyenne Mountain

Join us for a guided 1 mile hike along the Bear Track trail where we will search for and identify the different species we see flying, walking, or hanging out in the trees!

Pop-Up Craft Table @ Cheyenne Mountain

Stop by our pop-up craft table at the Visitor Center anytime between 12-1PM to create your very own coffee filter butterfly!
